Package de.oth.blocklib.entities

Class FlyingRock

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.entities.Entity
de.oth.blocklib.entities.FlyingRock
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, java.io.Serializable
public class FlyingRock
extends Entity
This class can be used to create rocks that can be thrown in any direction. An example of their usage is the MeteorShower Disaster.
Author:
Tobias Mueller
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • FlyingRock

      public FlyingRock​(short[][][] modelArray, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f position, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f velocity, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f rotationDelta, boolean createCollider)
      Creates a new FlyingRock
      Parameters:
      modelArray - Array which defines how the rock should look like
      position - current Position of the rock
      velocity - current speed of the rock (direction and value)
      rotationDelta - the rotation which should be applied the the rock
      createCollider - states if a Collider should or shouldn't be created

  • Method Details

    • calculateMass

      private void calculateMass()

    • shootSphereRock

      public static FlyingRock shootSphereRock​(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f start, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f direction, int radius, float speed)
      Can be used to easily create a sphere shaped flying rock.
      Parameters:
      start - the rocks initial position.
      direction - the direction in which it should fly
      radius - the radius of the created sphere
      speed - the inital speed of the rock
      Returns:
      a reference to the created FlyingRock

    • shootSphereRock

      public static FlyingRock shootSphereRock​(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f start, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f direction, int radius, float speed, java.lang.String outer, java.lang.String inner, java.lang.String splash)
      Can be used to easily create a sphere shaped flying rock.
      Parameters:
      start - the rocks initial position
      direction - the direction in which the stone should fly
      radius - the radius of the created rock
      speed - the initial speed of the rock
      outer - the blocktype that is used to create the outer shell
      inner - the blocktype that is used for the inner blocks of the flyingrock
      splash - the blocktype that is rarly found anywhere in the rock
      Returns:
      a reference to the created FlyingRock

      public void onTerrainCollision​(TerrainCollisionData data)
